content:
I have to deal with this each cycle and it is tiresome....

     [java]   ERROR: DiagnosticReport: Resource DiagnosticReport (FMM=3) cannot have an FMM level >1 (3) if it has warnings
     [java]   WARNING: DiagnosticReport.media.comment: MnM must have confirmed this should not be an Annotation
     [java]   WARNING: DiagnosticReport.media: Element names should be singular
Do I have to bring this up with MNM again before this ballot too?
if MnM has approved there's no reason to revisit unless something has changed

The comment warning came up for DSTU2 and STU3. The difference is the element name changed from image to media which I guess triggering these warnings. I think media was brought to MNM on a different thread but is obviously not plural.
If MnM has approved an exception and you've just changed the name, then just fix the name in the suppressed-messages.txt file
